name: Byte Kitchen
headline: Increasing restaurant profitability through our AI Operating System
description: Byte is able to quickly expand the geographic footprint of any given brand with minimal up front investment by licensing their IP, and rolling out their cuisine across a network of next generation kitchens optimized for delivery, pick up, and take out.

founders.name: Divyang Arora, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder and CEO at Byte Kitchen. I have experience in finance, business and operations through my work at Evercore, Booz and Co, JP Morgan. I was one of the first team members at a venture philanthropy org and helped scale its offerings and team. 

I graduated as a Baker Scholar from Harvard Business School and as a Systems Engineer (summa cum laude) from UPenn. I'm excited to help restaurants scale their offerings nationwide through the platform we are building at Byte Kitchen.

founders.name: Rahul Madadi, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and CTO at Byte Kitchen. Prior to Byte Kitchen, I co-founded a tech-enabled real estate startup. I have experience building and shipping products through my work at IBM Watson and Mphasis (HP and Blackstone portco). I graduated from Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) and later received my MBA from Indian Institute of Management (IIM). I am excited to develop products that allow restaurants to operate with an efficiency previously only accessible to giant chains

founders.name: Quinn McKenna, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder and COO at Byte Kitchen. For the past 30 years I have led operations for several large Bay Area restaurant companies, building and opening over 30 restaurants. I served as a director of the California Restaurant Association, and as an early advisor to restaurant tech companies OpenTable, Proven and Rezku. I earned my BA at the University of Virginia. 
I’m excited to be a part of the next chapter of the restaurant industry.

generated_description:
**Byte Kitchen Overview**
- **Founded:** 2021
- **Location:** San Mateo, CA
- **Team Size:** 5 employees
- **Y Combinator Batch:** S21
- **Website:** [bytekitchen.io](https://www.bytekitchen.io/)

**Mission**
Byte Kitchen aims to boost restaurant profitability using an AI-driven Operating System that simplifies and unifies restaurant operations. 

**Business Model**
Originally launched as "Byte," the company quickly expanded by allowing restaurant brands to license its intellectual property. This permits brands to extend their reach with minimal upfront investment by utilizing Byte Kitchen's network of next-gen kitchen facilities, designed specifically for delivery, pick-up, and take-out services.

**Core Offerings**
Byte Kitchen provides a comprehensive operating system that integrates multiple restaurant functions, reducing the burden of managing a "Jenga Tower" of disparate technologies. It offers several key products:
- **ByteCheck:** Streamlines operational tasks to enhance accuracy and speed.
- **ByteCater:** Optimizes catering workflows, saving time and reducing waste.
- **BytePrep:** Delivers smarter prep lists and order guides to cut down on food waste.
- **ByteShift:** Assists with seamless staff management and scheduling.

**Benefits & Performance**
The system boasts impressive performance metrics:
- Teams using ByteCheck report completing tasks 60% faster than traditional paper methods.
- ByteCater users save an average of 25 hours each month in managing catering orders.
- BytePrep can save over $17,000 annually by minimizing food waste through better planning.

**Testimonials**
Many users, like Akash Kapoor from Curry Up Now and Andrew Johnstone from The Little Chihuahua, have shared transformational experiences. They emphasize increased efficiency, enhanced customer satisfaction, and ultimately, higher profitability.

**Tags**
The company is recognized within the categories of ghost kitchens, B2B, e-commerce, and it has a specific regional focus in the San Francisco Bay Area.

**Conclusion**
Byte Kitchen is harnessing the power of technology to reshape how restaurants operate in a delivery-focused world, enabling brands to scale efficiently and profitably. If you're in the restaurant business and looking for a way to optimize operations, Byte Kitchen might just be the smart solution you need.
